node.title: CNN Suspends Chris Cuomo After New Details on Help He Gave His Brother
node.alt: The CNN anchor Chris Cuomo, brother of the former New York governor Andrew M. Cuomo, was placed on indefinite suspension on Tuesday.
node.description: The cable news networkâ€™s top-rated anchor was an enthusiastic adviser to Andrew Cuomo in the last 18 months of his governorship.
node.content: ["The star CNN anchor Chris Cuomo was suspended indefinitely by the network on Tuesday after new details emerged about his efforts to assist his brother, Andrew M. Cuomo, the former governor of New York, as he faced a cascade of sexual harassment accusations that led to the governor\u2019s resignation.", "Chris Cuomo had previously apologized for advising Andrew Cuomo\u2019s senior political aides \u2014 a breach of traditional barriers between journalists and lawmakers \u2014 but thousands of pages of new evidence released on Monday by the New York attorney general, Letitia James, revealed that the anchor\u2019s role had been more intimate and involved than previously known.", "\u201cThe documents, which we were not privy to before their public release, raise serious questions,\u201d CNN said in a statement on Tuesday.", "\u201cWhen Chris admitted to us that he had offered advice to his brother\u2019s staff, he broke our rules and we acknowledged that publicly,\u201d the network said. \u201cBut we also appreciated the unique position he was in and understood his need to put family first and job second. However, these documents point to a greater level of involvement in his brother\u2019s efforts than we previously knew.\u201d", "\u201cAs a result, we have suspended Chris indefinitely, pending further evaluation,\u201d the network said.", "In scores of emails and text messages between the television host and his brother\u2019s inner circle, Chris Cuomo repeatedly offered advice \u2014 \u201cPlease let me help with the prep,\u201d he texted a senior aide in March \u2014 and made efforts to track down the status of pending articles at other news outlets, including Politico and The New Yorker, that concerned allegations of sexual harassment by Andrew Cuomo.", "At one point, Andrew Cuomo\u2019s former top aide, Melissa DeRosa, asked the anchor if he could check his \u201csources\u201d about a rumor that Politico was working on an article that included additional accusations. \u201cOn it,\u201d Chris Cuomo responded.", "Chris Cuomo\u2019s entanglement with the last 18 months of his brother\u2019s governorship has proved a slow-moving headache for CNN, which had stood by its top-rated anchor even as a drip of uncomfortable revelations raised questions about the network\u2019s adherence to journalistic standards.", "Jeff Zucker, CNN\u2019s president, supported Mr. Cuomo for months, declining to discipline him even after reports showed that the anchor had conferred in strategy sessions with his brother\u2019s political team, a breach of basic reportorial conduct.", "But this week presented a harsher set of facts for Mr. Zucker as he weighed the fate of his 9 p.m. host.", "Ms. James\u2019s report included a text from Mr. Cuomo to Ms. DeRosa sent a few days after a woman, Anna Ruch, told The New York Times that Andrew Cuomo had made an unwanted advance toward her at a wedding in New York City. \u201cI have a lead on the wedding girl,\u201d the anchor wrote in the text.", "Chris Cuomo later told investigators that he had heard from a friend that \u201cmaybe she had been put up to it,\u201d referring to Ms. Ruch\u2019s allegation. He said that Andrew Cuomo\u2019s aides disavowed him of that notion and that he set his friend\u2019s claim aside. \u201cSo that\u2019s that,\u201d he said."]
